# Preact Starter - LLM Context

## Stack
- Preact (not React) - use `class` not `className`
- TypeScript
- Vite
- Tailwind CSS v4 (use `@import "tailwindcss"` syntax)
- preact-iso for routing
- @preact/signals for state

## Project Structure
```
src/
├── components/     # Reusable UI components
├── routes/         # Page components (one folder per route)
├── store/          # State management
├── app.tsx         # Router setup
├── main.tsx        # Entry point with StoreProvider
└── index.css       # Tailwind import
```

## Key Patterns

### Components
- Place in `src/components/ComponentName/`
- Use CSS modules for component-specific styles: `ComponentName.module.css`
- Use Tailwind utilities for layout and common styles

### Routes
- Place in `src/routes/RouteName/index.tsx`
- Add route to `src/app.tsx` Router

### State Management
Uses class-based AppModel with Preact Signals passed via context:

```tsx
// src/store/index.tsx
export class AppModel {
  #user: UserStore
  constructor() { this.#user = new UserStore() }
  get user() { return this.#user }
}

// Domain store with signals
import { signal } from '@preact/signals'
export class UserStore {
  currentUser = signal<User | null>(null)
  isLoading = signal(true)
}

// In components
import { useStore } from '../store'
function MyComponent() {
  const store = useStore()
  return <div>{store.user.currentUser.value?.name}</div>
}
```

### Routing (preact-iso)
```tsx
import { LocationProvider, Router, Route } from 'preact-iso'
<Router>
  <Route path="/" component={Home} />
  <Route path="/about" component={About} />
  <Route default component={NotFound} />
</Router>
```

## Commands
- `npm run dev` - Start dev server
- `npm run build` - Build for production
- `npm run preview` - Preview production build

## Notes
- Preact uses `class` not `className`
- Preact uses `for` not `htmlFor`
- Import hooks from `preact/hooks`
- Import signals from `@preact/signals`
